MD Notes: MD SNAP BBCE eliminates asset test; 200% FPL gross income threshold
Asset values not required for MD SNAP under BBCE
Asset verification not required for MD SNAP under BBCE
MD SNAP: not applicable under BBCE. Medicaid Non-MAGI: $2,000 individual / $3,000 couple (standard federal limits; MD is a 1634 state).
MD SNAP: always true under BBCE; no resource test
MD SNAP uses 200% FPL gross income threshold under BBCE versus federal 130% gross / 100% net
MD SNAP: 200% FPL gross income test only under BBCE; no net income test
BBCE removes categorical ineligibility for lottery/gambling winnings in MD SNAP
Follows substantialLotteryWinnings removal under BBCE
Area-based ABAWD time-limit waivers available in qualifying jurisdictions; Maryland has historically obtained statewide or partial waivers
MCHP covers lawfully present children and pregnant women regardless of immigration status under the CHIPRA option
Maryland Medicaid (MAGI): 138% FPL adults, 264% FPL pregnant women, 317% FPL children (MCHP). MCHP is among the most generous CHIP programs nationally. SSI auto-enrollment (1634 state).
MD is a 1634 state: SSI recipients receive automatic Maryland Medicaid enrollment
Employed Individuals with Disabilities (EID) program: working disabled buy-in for Medical Assistance; Maryland equivalent of federal Medicaid Buy-In
Must demonstrate current employment for EID (Employed Individuals with Disabilities) eligibility
MD uses federal 60-month look-back for asset transfers. Maryland Medical Assistance estate recovery follows federal standards under Md. Code, Health-Gen. § 15-121.
60-month federal lifetime limit applies. TCA is county-administered through local Departments of Social Services. Maryland applies standard federal time limits without state extensions.
TCA good cause exemption includes domestic violence per Family Violence Option; administered by local DSS offices
MEAP uses 175% FPL income threshold; year-round operation; OHEP (Office of Home Energy Programs) within DHS administers
OHEP administers MEAP; SUA linkage for SNAP shelter deduction. MEAP benefits include heating and cooling assistance.

MD Policy/Statute: Md. Code, Hum. Servs. § 5-5A-01 subd. 2; COMAR 07.06.16
MD Notes: MEAP crisis component: emergency assistance for imminent disconnection or fuel shortage; OHEP administers year-round separate from primary MEAP benefit
Maryland optional state supplement to SSI. MD is a 1634 state; SSA administers the federal SSI payment and the state supplement. Supplement amount varies by living arrangement.
Cash assistance for disabled adults pending or ineligible for SSI; $185/month maximum. Administered by local DSS offices. Requires temporary or permanent disability verification.
Cash assistance for elderly individuals age 65+ and legally blind adults. Administered by local DSS offices. Provides supplemental income for basic needs.

Subsidized child care for working families with income up to 65% of state median income (SMI). Administered by MSDE (Maryland State Department of Education). Co-payments based on family size and income.
Required for all state-only programs; PAA requires age 65+ or blindness; TDAP requires disability verification
Required for all state-only programs
Must meet disability criteria for TDAP eligibility; temporary or permanent disability pending or ineligible for SSI
CCS requires employment, job training, or education activity; must work or participate in approved activity
Income type required for all state-only programs
Income verification required for all state-only programs
Indicates need for child care subsidy; required for CCS eligibility. Must have children age 0-12 (or up to 18 with special needs).
Maryland has 24 jurisdictions (23 counties + Baltimore City as an independent city). Each jurisdiction operates a local Department of Social Services that administers benefits programs.
MD THINK (Total Human-services Integrated Network) platform case tracking number. CfA (Code for America) is actively building the Maryland Benefits application on MD THINK.
Verification of Maryland residency required for all state-administered programs
MD THINK platform client identifier; used across all state-administered programs
Determines Medical Assistance benefit set and funding source; categories include MA-MAGI, MA-LTC, EID, MCHP, Medicaid for Families
Added amharic|mandarin|french|haitian_creole|korean for DC metro area communities and Ethiopian/Eritrean communities per Maryland language access requirements
